body_html:
I can recompress the images, but I'm not sure about the value of doing this, on github.

Git stores the history, so while looking at an image will be more efficient, doesn't this just add bloat for anyone doing a git clone (without using the --depth flag)?

Isn't the right solution to move these to tensorflow.org and compress them there?
body_text:
I can recompress the images, but I'm not sure about the value of doing this, on github.
Git stores the history, so while looking at an image will be more efficient, doesn't this just add bloat for anyone doing a git clone (without using the --depth flag)?
Isn't the right solution to move these to tensorflow.org and compress them there?
body:
I can recompress the images, but I'm not sure about the value of doing this, on github.

Git stores the history, so while looking at an image will be more efficient, doesn't this just add bloat for anyone doing a git clone (without using the --depth flag)? 

Isn't the right solution to move these to tensorflow.org and compress them there?
